items.title: Trump believes iPhones can be made in the US, says White House
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt claims that iPhones could be manufactured in the US as tariffs approach.
- Leavitt cited Apple's $500 billion US investment plan as a sign of their confidence in American manufacturing.
- Previous statements from Steve Jobs and Tim Cook highlight the challenge of finding a sufficient number of skilled engineers in the US to support such manufacturing.

items.title: Tesla Supercharger damaged in possible explosion in Washington
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- A Tesla Supercharger station was severely damaged in a possible explosion in Lacey, Washington.
- Local police received multiple calls about a loud noise at 1:34am PT and discovered the damaged Supercharger station upon arrival.
- The incident is being investigated as "malicious mischief" and both the Lacey Police and the FBI are involved.
- Tesla's Supercharger account has stated they are on site reviewing camera footage with law enforcement.
- This incident is part of a series of vandalism targeting Tesla vehicles and infrastructure, including acts described as "domestic terrorism" by President Donald Trump.

items.title: Trump’s DOJ will no longer prosecute cryptocurrency fraud
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is disbanding a DOJ unit focused on cryptocurrency fraud enforcement.
- Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche issued a memo halting litigation on digital asset regulations.
- The DOJ will now target individuals who defraud digital asset investors and those using cryptocurrencies for serious crimes.
- Trump's administration is dropping ongoing investigations of companies like Robinhood and Coinbase.
- This shift indicates a move towards deregulating the cryptocurrency industry under Trump's leadership.

items.title: Loss of Pulse alerts are rolling out on Pixel Watch 3
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Google starts rolling out the Loss of Pulse Detection feature for Pixel Watch 3 owners in the U.S.
- This health feature can call emergency services if a heartbeat is not detected.
- Initially announced in August last year, it was available in Europe for months before FDA clearance in late February.
- Google tested the algorithm with over 100,000 hours of data to reduce false alerts.
- Users will need to wait for a prompt on the watch to enable the feature as it rolls out over the next couple of weeks.

items.title: Amazon plays catchup with new Nova AI models to generate voices and video
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Amazon introduces Nova Sonic, a conversational voice model designed to compete with Gemini Live and OpenAI’s Advanced Voice Mode.
- Nova Sonic features real-time speech processing and a unified model architecture for a more natural tone detection and response.
- The model is accessible via Amazon’s Bedrock platform for various applications like customer service bots and AI agents in diverse industries.
- Additionally, Amazon launched Nova Reel 1.1, which improves video quality and consistency across multi-shot videos up to two minutes long.

items.title: The next season of Love, Death, and Robots is coming to Netflix this May
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore

items.title: Razer pauses direct laptop sales in the US as new tariffs loom
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Razer's new Blade 16 and other laptops are no longer available for direct purchase due to impending tariffs.
- Tariffs set to take effect tonight led to the halt of sales; Razer's configurator was available as recently as April 1st.
- Other companies, including Framework and Micron, are also responding to the tariffs by halting sales or notifying customers of surcharges.
- The direct link to Blade 16's configurator now leads to a 404 error, with the website showing only a 'notify me' button for preorders.
- Razer has not commented on the impact of tariffs but has paused direct sales on its US site.

items.title: Trump will hit China with 104 percent tariffs
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- The US will impose a cumulative 104 percent tariff on goods imported from China, confirmed by the White House.
- This is part of President Trump's trade war, aimed at equality in trade and bringing jobs back to the US, but critics warn it may harm consumers and businesses.
- Trump's initial tariff plan was for 34 percent; this escalation follows China's own imposed tariffs on US goods.

items.title: The kid-friendly Fitbit Ace has returned to its best price to date
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Fitbit Ace LTE is currently priced at $149.95, a $30 discount from its normal price.
- It is designed to engage kids in exercise through games and features like calling and texting preselected contacts.
- The watch requires an Ace Pass for LTE features at $9.99 a month and has parental controls for safety.

items.title: Hades II will launch first for consoles on Nintendo Switch and Switch 2
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Hades II will be a console exclusive on Nintendo Switch systems, launching from early access.
- Nintendo announced the game will be available on both Switch and Switch 2, with a new video highlighting its features.
- Developer Supergiant Games emphasized the importance of 60 fps gameplay for Switch 2, confirming additional graphical enhancements.
- Supergiant clarified that Hades II will also launch on the original Switch upon reaching version 1.0, with more details expected later this year.

items.title: YouTube says Nope! to age-gating Balatro videos
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- YouTube's Balatro University posted a video revealing age restrictions on some of their content due to tightened gambling policies.
- YouTube later stated that Balatro gameplay videos should not be age-restricted and they are reviewing the restrictions.
- Balatro, a game with gambling themes, initially received a PEGI 18 rating but was later revised to PEGI 12 after an appeal, emphasizing the need for better classification criteria.

items.title: Most Americans don’t trust AI — or the people in charge of it
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- A Pew Research Center report reveals a divide between AI experts and the public on the perception of AI technology.
- About 75% of AI experts believe the technology will benefit them personally, while only 25% of the public shares this view.
- More than half of both AI experts and the public want more control over AI usage and do not trust government or private companies to regulate it effectively.
- Gen Z is highly engaged with AI tools, yet they express more anxiety (41%) than excitement (36%) about AI's impact.
- Most young people believe that AI could harm their critical thinking abilities, and there's a lack of clear AI policies in schools and workplaces.

items.title: Nintendo is delaying Switch 2 preorders in Canada, too
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nintendo has delayed Switch 2 preorders in Canada, previously set for April 9, 2025.
- The delay is to align with preorder schedules in the US, due to new tariffs from the Trump administration.
- The launch date for the Switch 2 remains unchanged at June 5, 2025.
- Nintendo will update customers on preorder details at a later date.
- A recent Direct on April 2nd revealed titles like *Mario Kart World* and upgraded versions of *The Legend of Zelda* as launch titles.

items.title: Elon Musk dies to tutorial boss in Path of Exile 2 livestream
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Elon Musk streamed himself playing *Path of Exile 2* during a flight to test Starlink internet service.
- The stream lasted about 1 hour and 45 minutes, with Musk rarely speaking and focusing on the game.
- Viewers sent both supportive and abusive messages, with Musk making no moves to disable them.
- Musk played on hardcore difficulty, dying multiple times, and ultimately got defeated by a tutorial boss due to a poor connection, ending the stream.

items.title: The modifiers
Is there a ‘right’ way to use AI in art?
items.author: Andrew Rosenblum
items.summary:
- Many artists oppose the use of AI tools like Midjourney and Stability AI due to concerns about exploitation of training data.
- Painter Brett Amory uses generative AI creatively, focusing on worldbuilding and glitch art instead of producing generic images.
- Art critic Ben Davis emphasizes the current ambiguity around moral guidelines for using AI in art.
- Artists have historically manipulated AI, with notable examples like Steph Maj Swanson’s creation of the AI Cryptid Loab.
- Laurie Simmons combines AI with traditional art methods to reflect cultural memories.
- Techniques traced back to glitch art showcase how technology errors have been used creatively since the late 20th century.
- The rise of AI may diminish the perceived value of individual artistic styles, according to Davis.
- Some artists have engaged in lawsuits against AI companies for unauthorized use of their work, while others utilize tools to protect their art from being scraped by AI.
- There is still uncertainty regarding copyright for AI-generated works, but the US Copyright Office has started registering works incorporating AI elements.

items.title: CalDigit’s new Thunderbolt 5 docks bring plenty of ports
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- CalDigit releases two new Thunderbolt 5 docks: the TS5 and TS5 Plus.
- TS5 features 15 ports and is priced at $369.99, launching May 2025.
- TS5 Plus boasts 20 ports with a price of $499.99, available late April 2025.
- TS5 Plus includes three Thunderbolt 5 ports and offers up to 80Gbps transfer speeds.
- Allows connection of multiple 4K displays for Windows and up to 8K for Mac users.
- New docks support optimized power delivery, with TS5 Plus capable of 140W for host devices.

items.title: How an unused nuclear power plant became home to a world-class acoustics lab
items.author: Allison Johnson

items.title: The Best Android Phones of 2025
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- The Android ecosystem offers a wide range of choices for consumers compared to iPhones.
- Key features for choosing an Android phone include durability, long software support, and camera capabilities.
- The Google Pixel 9 is highlighted as a strong choice, offering seven years of updates and a fast fingerprint sensor for $799.
- Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is noted for its extensive features but comes with a hefty price of $1100.
- The Samsung Galaxy S25 is recommended as one of the last reasonably sized Android phones, priced at $720.

items.title: Microsoft’s new Windows 11 Start menu is bigger and fixes a major pain point
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is redesigning the Windows 11 Start menu to be larger and more customizable.
- The new design allows users to disable the recommended feed of files and apps, addressing user complaints.
- The updated Start menu will feature a scrollable page and improved access to all apps, with layouts customizable between category view and list view.
- This new design will accommodate more pinned apps, up to 8 per row, with no limit on rows.
- Testing for the new Start menu has begun in 24H2 builds and it will also be backported to 23H2 versions, indicating a rollout to all users in the near future.

items.title: Motorola’s stylish stylus phone comes in blue or blue
items.author: Allison Johnson

items.title: Switch 2: the good news and bad news
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Nintendo’s Switch 2 is seen as a significant improvement over the original Switch.
- Pre-orders have been delayed due to tariffs, possibly increasing the console's price.
- Ash Parrish shares hands-on experience with the console’s features such as the screen quality and new game controls.
- Discussion on the upcoming game Donkey Kong Bananza and its potential.
- Microsoft’s recent anniversary celebration includes a mix of festivities and protests.
- Concerns about Trump’s tariffs and their impact on consumer electronics prices.

items.title: Teen restrictions expand on Instagram, Facebook, and Messenger
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Meta is expanding protections for teens on Instagram, Facebook, and Messenger to prevent inappropriate contact and content.
- Instagram’s ‘Teen Accounts’ introduced in September automatically make accounts private for younger users, restricting access to certain features.
- New protections for Facebook and Messenger Teen Accounts rollout in the US, UK, Australia, and Canada, requiring parental permission for users under 16 to make changes.
- Current features include messaging restrictions and reminders for offline time, alongside tighter controls for sensitive content.
- Meta faces investigations in the EU and lawsuits in the US related to child safety on its platforms.

items.title: Meta caught manipulating AI benchmarks to enhance Llama 4's reputation
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- Meta released two Llama 4 models: Scout and Maverick; Maverick claims to outperform GPT-4o and Gemini 2.0 Flash in benchmarks.
- Maverick secured the second position on LMArena, with an ELO score of 1417, higher than OpenAI's 4o.
- Researchers found that the tested version of Maverick wasn't the same as the public model, as it was an 'experimental chat version' optimized for conversationality.
- LMArena stated that Meta should have clarified the model used for testing, leading to policy changes for clearer evaluations in the future.
- Some AI community members accused Meta of training on test sets, which the company denied, attributing performance variability to implementation issues.
- Llama 4's weekend release raised eyebrows, with Meta's CEO claiming it was ready at that time despite unusual timing in AI news.

items.title: The Best Budget Robot Vacuums
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Today's robot vacuums can range from simple models to high-tech devices with advanced features.
- The article highlights budget robot vacuums that provide effective cleaning without extra frills.
- Key recommendations include the Tapo RV30 Max Plus ($230) with lidar navigation and auto-empty dock, and the Roborock S8 ($400) with advanced suction and dual brushes.
- The Shark Ion ($150) is noted for good suction and pet hair removal without tangling.
- Features to consider when selecting a budget robot vacuum include suction power, bin capacity, and navigation type.
- It's recommended to avoid ultra-cheap models under $200 from unknown brands, and instead consider sales on older, reputable models.

items.title: Framework stops selling some of its cheapest laptops due to Trump tariffs
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Framework is temporarily pausing US sales on some laptops due to new tariffs imposed by the Trump administration.
- The affected models include some base Framework Laptop 13 systems with specific processors.
- The company stated the tariffs prevent them from selling at a profitable price, as their laptops were priced before the tariffs were implemented.
- Framework's situation reflects broader trends in the industry, as other companies have also adjusted their offerings due to tariffs.

items.title: The Best Noise-Canceling Headphones to Buy Right Now
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- [Noise-canceling headphones are essential for commuting, travel, and focused work.]
- [Top recommended brands include Sony, Bose, Apple, Bowers & Wilkins, and Sennheiser.]
- [The Sony WH-1000XM5 is noted for excellent sound quality, comfort, and noise cancellation.] 
- [Features like multipoint Bluetooth connectivity allow pairing with multiple devices.] 
- [Bose’s QuietComfort headphones offer exemplary comfort and noise cancellation.] 
- [Apple AirPods Max provides high-quality materials and effective noise cancellation but at a higher price.]

items.title: Gemini Live's screensharing feature is rolling out to Pixel 9 and Galaxy S25 devices
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Google’s Gemini Live camera and screenshare functions are now rolling out on Pixel 9 and Galaxy S25 devices.
- The update will soon be available for other Android devices, but requires a paid Gemini Advanced subscription.
- Users can ask Gemini Live real-time questions about what the camera sees and receive answers, such as identifying fish in an aquarium.
- The features were first demonstrated at Google I/O in May as part of Project Astra and are now available in 45 languages for users aged 18 and older.

items.title: Shopify CEO says no new hires without proof AI can't do the job
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Shopify CEO Tobi Lütke sent a memo requiring teams to justify new hires by demonstrating AI's incapacity to perform the tasks.
- Lütke emphasized that AI usage should be considered a baseline expectation within the company.
- The memo discussed the rapid integration of AI in workflows and mentioned that effective AI application is a fundamental skill required of all employees at Shopify.
- AI-related performance questions will be included in the company's review processes.

items.title: Some Shein and Temu ‘haul video’ creators are stocking up
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- TikTok creator @pwinpudding buys items in anticipation of tariffs that could affect low-cost goods from China.
- President Trump announced new tariffs on April 2nd that will significantly impact imports from China, including items popular in haul videos.
- Creator Donna Leah expresses frustration over price hikes and considers shifting content towards upcycling and thrifting.
- Starting May 2nd, the de minimis exemption for packages under $800 will end, leading to additional fees for items shipped from China and Hong Kong.
- Creator Clarissa Shah plans to continue her hauls despite expected price increases, citing budget-friendliness for her audience.
- The new tariffs could also raise clothing prices across other retailers, affecting about 97% of clothing imports in the US.

items.title: It's not looking good for Tesla's Cybertruck range extender
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Tesla's Cybertruck range extender, originally set to extend range to 445 miles, has been removed from the online configurator.
- The range extender was announced as a $16,000 add-on but appears to be delayed or possibly cancelled, initially promised for early 2025.
- A $2,000 non-refundable fee has been collected from customers who reserved the range extender, and it's unclear how Tesla will handle this if the product does not launch.
- The current highest range for the Cybertruck is 325 miles for the dual-motor AWD model, now priced at $79,990.

items.title: You can build these marble runs and connect them to your smart home over Wi-Fi
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Marblelous is a new marble run building set featuring Wi-Fi-connected components to enhance play.
- The Kickstarter campaign has surpassed its funding goal of $10,952.
- A basic starter set costs around $87 and includes 10 meters of track, while a Mega Geek Pack costs about $547.
- Expected shipping starts as early as June 2025.
- Compatible with any six-millimeter straws, with supports for vertical surfaces.
- Advanced components called Smart-Tricks include motorized lifts, lane switchers, and teleporters.
- A marble-detecting sensor connects to a mobile app, enabling interactions with smart home devices.

items.title: Waymo: ‘no plans’ to use in-car camera data for targeted ads
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Waymo spokesperson Julia Ilina confirmed there are "no plans" to use in-cabin camera footage for targeted advertisements.
- This statement responds to an unreleased privacy policy offering an opt-out option for personal data usage, including interior camera data.
- Waymo's robotaxis are equipped with cameras for safety measures, including monitoring passenger behavior and vehicle cleanliness; however, this data will not be used for AI training for ads.

items.title: You can borrow and resell Nintendo's Switch 2 game-key cards
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nintendo’s new game-key cards allow borrowing, renting, and reselling without being tied to a specific account.
- Game-key cards automatically trigger a game download on any Switch 2 console.
- After first-time launch, games can be played offline as long as the game-key card is inserted.
- This new format merges aspects of digital downloads and physical cartridges, allowing larger games than the traditional 64GB cartridge.

items.title: Microsoft fires employee protestor who called AI boss a ‘war profiteer’
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft fired employee Ibtihal Aboussad for misconduct during the company's 50th anniversary event.
- Aboussad and another protestor interrupted CEO Mustafa Suleyman, accusing him of being a "war profiteer."
- Both protestors called for Microsoft to cease contracts with the Israeli government, associating with the group No Azure for Apartheid.
- Aboussad was escorted out of the event, and Agrawal resigned but was dismissed shortly after.
- An internal email cited the disruptive nature of their actions and lack of remorse as reasons for the terminations.

items.title: Whoopsie daisy Bitcoin!
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.explanation: A gun is the ultimate surprise party crasher for an assassin—hard to dodge that!

items.title: Google TV remotes are getting a ‘Free TV’ button
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Google TV devices will now include a ‘Free TV’ or ‘Live TV’ button on remotes, confirmed by a company spokesperson.
- The button will provide quick access to free, ad-supported TV channels via Google TV FreePlay.
- Google states this change aims to enhance user experience, responding positively to feedback since launching free live TV options.
- Details on the button's size, color, and requirement scope (regional or worldwide) have not been disclosed.

items.title: Here are the best streaming service deals available right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- 2025 offers great streaming options but subscription costs can add up.
- Current deals include promotions for both new and returning subscribers across various services.
- Disney Plus offers a bundle with Hulu and ESPN for $10.99/month.
- Hulu provides an ad-supported plan at $9.99/month with access to shows like 'The Handmaid’s Tale'.
- Peacock offers next-day programming from NBC and live sports starting at $7.99/month for ad-supported content.

items.title: Major publishers call on the US government to ‘Stop AI Theft’
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Hundreds of publishers, including The New York Times, The Washington Post, and The Guardian, are launching an ad campaign urging the U.S. government to protect content from AI.
- The campaign, named Support Responsible AI, includes phrases like “Keep Watch On AI” and “AI Steals From You Too.”
- The initiative aims to promote fair compensation for publishers by Big Tech companies using their content without authorization.

items.title: The best Nintendo Switch controllers to buy right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch Pro Controller is highly recommended for its quality, features, and compatibility with multiple platforms.
- The Hori Split Pad Pro is favored for handheld mode, offering better ergonomics and additional rear buttons but lacks features like motion control and rumble.
- GuliKit KingKong 3 Pro and Max controllers provide Xbox-style ergonomics with deep customization options and advanced technology to prevent drift.
- Third-party controllers may lack some Nintendo features like NFC and HD rumble, but select options are versatile and well-built.

items.title: The White House’s group chat screwup is even more ridiculous than we thought
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- National security adviser Mike Waltz accidentally added a journalist to a Signal chat due to a Siri suggestion.
- The mistake occurred while trying to update contact details for a Trump spokesperson.
- Internal investigation revealed miscommunication involving an email from Atlantic's Jeffrey Goldberg.
- The White House's choice of Signal for sensitive discussions raises concerns over security protocols.

items.title: The see-through Beats Studio Buds Plus are on sale for less than $100
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The **Beats Studio Buds Plus** are currently priced at **$99.95**, down from **$169.95**, matching their best price to date.
- The earbuds feature a **translucent color option** and provide sound quality that rivals the pricier **AirPods Pro**.
- They are water-resistant, come with four swappable silicone ear tips, and have **transparency mode** and **Active Noise Cancellation** (ANC).
- Unlike AirPods Pro, they support a variety of **iOS and Android** functionalities including **Find My** and **Fast Pair** but lack features like head-tracking spatial audio.

items.title: Nintendo’s Switch 2 upgrade packs for Zelda will cost $9.99
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Nintendo announces that the Switch 2 upgrades for the Legend of Zelda games will cost $9.99 for existing owners.
- The prices for the new Switch 2 Zelda games are $69.99 for Breath of the Wild and $79.99 for Tears of the Kingdom.
- Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour will also be priced at $9.99, despite debate over whether it should be included with the console.
- Pre-orders for the Switch 2 have started in other countries; U.S. pricing affected by tariffs remains uncertain.

items.title: GM's UK Design Team Unveils Futuristic Electric Corvette Concept
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- GM reveals a new electric Corvette concept designed by a UK team in Birmingham.
- The concept features a hypercar design with aviation-inspired elements, powered gullwing doors, and an augmented windshield display.
- The upper half of the design is based on the classic 1963 Corvette Sting Ray, described as 'Apex Vision'.
- EV battery technology is integrated into the vehicle's structure for improved efficiency.
- On tracks, the Corvette can deploy dorsal fins for aerodynamics and better cornering performance.
- A new GMC concept vehicle, designed for camping, is set to be revealed later this year.

items.title: Google's AI Mode can now see and search with images
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google introduces multimodal capabilities to its AI Mode chatbot, enhancing image recognition features.
- Users can now upload or snap a picture to receive detailed responses and links about the content.
- The update combines Gemini AI with Lens image recognition, accessible in the Google app on Android and iOS starting today.
- Offers nuanced responses by issuing multiple queries about objects in images, helping to identify subjects and suggest related content.
- AI Mode, which launched last month for Google One AI Premium subscribers, is now expanding to millions more users in the US.

items.title: The Last of Us season 2 is a brutal, bloody expansion of the game
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Season 2 covers roughly half of the plot of 
  [The Last of Us Part II](https://www.theverge.com/tv-reviews/644415/the-last-of-us-season-2-review-hbo) in seven episodes, shorter than the first season's nine episodes.
- The storyline centers on Ellie and Joel, focusing on themes of revenge and personal sacrifice after a pivotal decision by Joel.
- The season explores broader character developments and world-building, introducing new characters and deeper plot elements, enhancing the narrative's context.
- The season premiered on April 13th on HBO and Max, continuing the grim and violent themes of the source material.

items.title: Death Stranding movie nabs director of Pig and A Quiet Place: Day One
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Michael Sarnoski has been announced as the director and writer for the upcoming *Death Stranding* movie.
- Sarnoski previously directed *Pig* and *A Quiet Place: Day One*.
- The movie is based on Hideo Kojima’s 2019 video game, which follows Sam Porter Bridges, portrayed by Norman Reedus.
- *Death Stranding* features surreal elements, including supernatural monsters and a unique delivery concept.
- A sequel titled *Death Stranding 2: On the Beach* is set to launch on June 26th.

items.title: 22 years later, modders are keeping SimCity 4 alive
items.author: Tom Hawking
items.summary:
- SimCity 4 was released in 2003 and has a dedicated modding community that has developed extensive modifications over the years.
- Modders like Tarkus and Ulisse Wolf emphasize the game's unmatched simulation depth and the supportive community as key reasons for continuing to work on the game.
- The Network Addon Mod (NAM) is a significant project that enhances the game's transportation systems and continues to evolve with a dedicated team of global contributors.
- Modding has grown with improved access to the game's source code, allowing for advanced custom features and bug fixes.
- The vibrant community actively collaborates across forums and platforms like Discord, fostering a friendly environment for both veterans and newcomers.

items.title: One of the best 4K QD-OLED gaming monitors is cheaper than ever
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Alienware’s 27-inch 4K QD-OLED, the AW2725Q, launched a month ago at CES 2025.
- Now available at $749, down from the regular price of $899, a 17% discount.
- Features include a 240Hz refresh rate, VRR, and a high 166 pixels per inch display.
- Includes a 3-year warranty against burn-in and has an anti-reflective coating.
- Alienware also plans to release a 27-inch 1440p QD-OLED monitor for $549.99 this summer, but prices may vary due to tariffs.

items.title: Nintendo confirms Switch 2 Joy-Cons lack Hall effect joysticks
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nintendo Joy-Cons redesigned for the Switch 2 but do not use Hall effect sensors for anti-drift.
- Senior VP Nate Bihldorff confirmed Joy-Con 2 not Hall Effect, indicating different feel.
- Switch 2 controllers are larger, more durable; details on the technology used remain undisclosed.
